sentence.idiomatic: He will take responsibility for this project.

word.literal: to go on a business trip

sentence.idiomatic: The boss should decide whom to send out on a business trip.
Now it's Wang's turn to tell everyone who this year's top salesperson is.
Our company has always wanted to open up the Chinese market.
This website won't open.
Next, please open your textbooks, everyone.
This is not a bad idea. Can you give some specifics?
First I'll give a brief introduction. For details you can see the materials.
Analyze concrete problems in a concrete way.
His dad looks really serious.
Don't be so serious, everyone. Relax a little.
The teacher sternly criticized me.
The Beijing Olympics reduced the distance between China and the countries of the world.
To reduce the distance between herself and her mother-in-law, she often goes to buy vegetables with her mother-in-law.
Can you zoom the camera lens in a bit?
When you write articles, you definitely should make the key points stand out.
This design makes Chinese culture's special characteristics stand out.
His talent stands out the most on this team.
During the activity, she got her fans excited about getting together to help the poor.
This afternoon the school will hold a mobilization meeting. Every student will come take part.
Let's all mobilize to protect the environment.
Your body definitely can't handle working overtime every day.
After running just a bit, I just couldn't take it any longer.

word.literal: to be able to handle something

sentence.idiomatic: The tuition is so high, how can ordinary families handle it?

``Hello everyone. Today I'm going to explain our new sales plan to everybody. This year, our main focus is on opening new markets. Next, we have a lot of concrete work to do, but the most important thing is for everyone to work hard together. Let's go for it!" What do you think?
Good. But you're too serious. You need to reduce the distance between you and your listeners.

Oh. Then I'll try it again. ``Hello everyone. Today I'm going to explain our new sales plan to everybody. I feel very honored. This year, our focus is on opening new markets. Next, we have a lot of concrete work to do, but the most important thing is for everyone to work hard together. Let's go for it!"
Hmm. Much better than the last time. But at key points, your tone can be a little more emphatic. For example, ``the new sales plan," ``everyone working hard together."
I think that's too exaggerated. It's like acting in a play.
It's not exaggerated at all. If you don't make the key points stand out, there's no way to get everyone excited.

Fine, fine. I'll try again. ``Hello, everyone. Today I'm going to introduce the new sales plan to everyone. I feel very honored. This year, our focus is on opening new markets. We have a lot of concrete work to do, but the most important thing is for everyone to work hard. Let's go for it!"
Excellent!
But I still have a lot of stuff I want to say. Practicing like this is more than I can handle.
Actually, you only need to pay attention to the mood, the tone, and making the listeners feel interested. If you do that, it'll be a success.
Then I'll practice it one more time. ``Hello everyone..."
